text: Percy Heath (April 30, 1923 - April 28, 2005) was an American jazz bassist. He was the brother of saxophonist Jimmy Heath and drummer Albert Heath, with whom he formed the Heath Brothers in 1975. Heath played with the Modern Jazz Quartet throughout their long history and also worked with Miles Davis, Dizzy Gillespie, Charlie Parker, Wes Montgomery, and Thelonious Monk. ==Other websites== * National Endowment for the Arts - NEA Jazz Masters biography * Brotherly Jazz: The Heath Brothers DVD Documentary Category:1923 births Category:2005 deaths Category:Deaths from bone cancer Category:Cancer deaths in New York (state) Category:American jazz musicians Category:Musicians from North Carolina
title: Percy Heath
